args: A dangerous heretic who abducts children?\nI'm dealing with a real piece of work.
He's clearly the reason why kids have\nbeen disappearing from this town.
Time to knock him out and take him in\nbefore he can claim any more victims.
Work. I've taken on an urgent request.
You're not sticking your head into\ntrouble again, are you?
I'll not share details of my job with you.\nI have a duty to protect my clients' privacy.
(Ugh, he never changes. But this time,\nI'm gonna REALLY stun him with what\nI can do.)
You know, I'm actually working\non a case right now as well.
Oh? And what would that be?
If you're gonna give me the confidentiality\nexcuse, I'll also keep my own counsel.
Then I shall ask no more.
But on that subject, what do you say\nwe compete to see who can solve\ntheir case first?
Loser has to do one thing the winner says.\nSound good?
I did not come here to compete with you.
And yet, I can't say I have no interest\nin seeing you beg for mercy.
That's a pretty cocky attitude to be taking\nbefore we've even started, bub.
You're gonna live to regret it!
I haven't even agreed to this madness.\nHonestly, you are incorrigible.
Through his investigation, Curran determined the\nlocation of one of the kidnapped children.
Hey! You're safe now.\nI'm here for yo—
I have come to rescue you, small one.\nNow let us be off.
Hey! What are YOU doing here?!
Ah ha ha! It seems our requests\nwere surprisingly similar.
But that is not what matters right now.\nCome with me, young man—you have\nnothing to fear now.
You're lying! You're one of THEM!\nLook how weird you're dressed!
You should never judge someone by their\nappearance, young one.

You might have smarts when it comes to
solving cases, but you're TERRIBLE when
it comes to handling kids. Logic's not
gonna get you anywhere with them.
Hey, I'm no bad guy. I'm with the Church.\nAnd unlike Doctor Weirdo over there,\nI actually dressed the part.
See the ring attached to my outfit?\nIt's called the Halo. You've seen priests\nwith it before, right?
Hey, yeah! So you're really with\nthe Church, mister?
Sure am—and while this guy might\nhave suspicious written all over him,\nhe's actually one of my lackeys.
So now we're on the same page,\nI know there are more kidnapping victims.
Can you tell us anything about\nwho took you?
He said he'd give us food, so we all\nfollowed him—then we got locked in here.
After a while, he took the other kids\nout to the edge of town.
(That area has a bunch of deserted houses,\nso it would be the perfect stash spot.)
How come you got left behind?
I'm small, so I hid under the desk.\nThe others didn't tell.
Thanks for telling me all this.\nNow hurry home, all right?
Hmph. I suppose one can't beat a\nman of the cloth for tasks like these.
Aw, you're gonna make me blush.\nAnyway, it's time for the big finale.\nGimme a hand, Heinwald!
Very well. This way no one can say I still\nowe you one.
Eee hee hee! I've got everything I need\nto begin my experiment—it's time to\nget down to work.
You're going to feel like you've all\ngone to heaven! Eee hee hee!
You're not gonna be laying a FINGER\non those kids, scum!
I'm with the Ilian Church!\nNow give up before this gets ugly!
How did you find this place?!
Heinwald, take care of the kids!\nI'll handle this guy!
Understood. I'll leave the combat to you.\nGood luck.
I make my own luck. Now get going!\nRaaaaagh!
And I rescued all of the children.\nIt appears our task is complete.
I'm hoping you remember our little wager.
Since I caught the guy I was after,\nthat means I win!
Oh? I believe I finished my task slightly\nbefore you completed yours.
Wait. Was the job you were working on...
Saving one of the abducted children,\nyes. This girl, in point of fact.
She's from a poor family, so no one was\never going to search for her.
By coincidence I became acquainted with\nher parents, and they begged me for help.
Wait, so I lost? Damn it!
Fiiine! Just...tell me what to do.
No. As I was only able to rescue\nher thanks to your valiant efforts,\nwe shall call this your victory.
Nope! I'm not going back on my word.\nYou finished your job first—you win.
I never even officially agreed to compete.\nTo be honest, I couldn't care less about\nthis whole absurd contest.
...But very well. There is one thing\nyou could do for me.
Unfortunately, these children see me\nas just another heretic. ...Observe.
Well, sure, they do seem a little wary.\nBut that's no surprise after all they've\nbeen through.
That's why I need you to do what\nyou did earlier and calm them.
Just look smug and talk about the\ngoddess's infinite love or...whatever\nyou do.
I'm not some kind of orphanage helper,\nyou know.
I calmed the kid earlier without thinking,\nbut I'm no saint—my hands are stained\nwith the blood of heretics.
How's a monster like me supposed to\npreach about the goddess's infinite love?
Is the goddess you worship so heartless\nthat she can't even save a few children?
Accept the inevitable: You are the only one\nwho can do the goddess's work here.
...Bah. I guess sometimes you've just\ngotta do what you've gotta do.
Listen up, everyone. My name's Curran,\nand I'm with the Ilian Church.
Cor! Yer a liar, so ya is!
Church people all wear white!\nYou can't fool us!
Ack... W-well, have a look at this Halo!\nAll of Ilia's followers carry one!
Same plan won't work twice, huh?\nAll right, just hear me out.
My job is beating up bad guys in the\ngoddess's place. That's why my outfit\nis a different color.
That's why I dealt with the nasty guy\nwho kidnapped you.
And I won't let anyone else harm you.\nWill you at least believe that?
The Church beats up bad people?\nI thought it was just about praying.
The Church has all kinds of people in it.\nSome heal the sick and injured, while\nsome give food to the hungry.
You mean them nice folks what\nhand out the soup!
Exactly. You see, the goddess is always\nprotecting you—sometimes with kindness,\nand other times with strength.
So if you ever find yourself in a scary\nsituation again, just pray.
If you do, someone really strong like me\nwill come and save you. On Ilia's orders.
Blimey! The Goddess would do all that?!
She sure would. This world is filled with\nher love—so whenever you need help,\njust rely on the Church.
Then your future will be filled with\njoy and haminess!
Bah. I had to trip on the last hurdle.
All right, that's enough fun for one day.\nLet's get you all home.
You don't need to flatter me. I'm not suited\nto this stuff; I feel all weird now.
There's no harm in you taking some time\naway from fighting to talk about Ilia's love\nfor children, surely?
I can decide how to spend my own time,\nthanks. I'm just better suited to beating\nup bad guys than praying.
Talking about love can wait until all\nthe world's evils are dead. Until then,\nI've still got work to do.
